title: Remove authentication and add WCA competition-based Practice Session flow (WCA API + 5 scrambles, browser-only persistence)

requirements.text: Remove all login/signup/authentication functionality from the frontend UI so the app is fully usable without any login, including removing or disabling the Login modal, Account modal, and any header/account controls that depend on authentication state.

quotes: So for the time we will proceed with full removing login functions and no other login or signup required at this time.

acceptanceCriteria: The app has no visible Login/Sign Up entry points (no Login button, no auth dropdown, no auth modals).
Timer-related features (event select, scramble, timer, stats, solve history) work without any authentication state.
No frontend code references the email/password auth hook/provider in runtime paths (build compiles cleanly).

requirements.text: Remove all email/password authentication logic from the backend canister interface (signup/login/logout/profile session behavior) so the backend no longer exposes or depends on email/password auth for core app usage.

quotes: proceed with full removing login functions and no other login or signup required at this time

acceptanceCriteria: `backend/main.mo` no longer exposes callable methods for `signup`, `login`, and `logout` as a required app flow.
Backend builds successfully under the single-actor architecture.
Frontend builds successfully against the updated backend bindings (no type or import errors).

requirements.text: Add a new Practice Session feature accessible from the main UI (alongside the existing timer experience), with a dedicated entry point labeled “Practice” (English UI text).

quotes: We needto implement a function as practice session whereusers can practic for wca listedd competions. When user select practic page, they will see the available wca listed from upcoming list

acceptanceCriteria: A user can navigate to a “Practice” area from within the app without logging in.
Navigation does not rely on modifying any immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

requirements.text: On the Practice page, fetch and display the list of upcoming WCA competitions from the official WCA API, and render them in a scrollable list with competition name and location metadata when available.
acceptanceCriteria: Upcoming competitions are fetched client-side from the official WCA API over HTTPS.
A loading state and an error state are shown if the request is in progress or fails.
Competitions render as a list; selecting a competition advances to the next step.

requirements.text: Provide filtering on the Practice competitions list: (1) filter by country and (2) search by competition name or country name (case-insensitive).

quotes: they can filter it based on country or search with competition name or country name

acceptanceCriteria: A user can restrict the list to a chosen country (via dropdown or equivalent).
A user can type a query that filters by competition name or country name.
Filters can be cleared to return to the full upcoming list.

requirements.text: After a competition is selected, display its available events and allow the user to select an event to practice.

quotes: They can select the competition then it will show the events and they can select

acceptanceCriteria: Selected competition view shows a list/grid of events for that competition.
Selecting an event advances to a “ready”/practice session screen for that competition+event.

requirements.text: On the Practice “ready” page, generate and display 5 random WCA-standard scrambles for the selected event, matching the “Scramble 1/5” style shown in the uploaded reference images.

quotes: the ready page will 5 random generated scrambled for them everything just like the image attached

acceptanceCriteria: Exactly 5 scrambles are generated for the selected event and displayed to the user.
The UI indicates the current scramble index (e.g., “Scramble 1/5”).
A user can move through the set of 5 scrambles (next/previous or equivalent) without regenerating the entire set unless they explicitly refresh/regenerate.

requirements.text: Persist Practice Session state in the browser only (no canister persistence): at minimum save the selected competition, selected event, generated 5 scrambles, and the user’s current scramble index so that a refresh restores the session.

quotes: Let's save it in browser itself

acceptanceCriteria: Practice session state is restored after a page refresh in the same browser.
No backend calls are used to store practice session state.
There is a clear way for the user to reset/clear the saved practice session state from the UI.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent dark, competition-focused visual theme consistent across the new Practice flow screens (browse competitions, select event, ready page), using a charcoal/graphite base with high-contrast accents (avoid blue & purple).

quotes: everything just like the image attached

acceptanceCriteria: Practice pages share a consistent layout system (spacing, cards, typography) with the existing app styling.
Theme uses a dark base with non-blue/non-purple accent colors consistently applied to interactive elements and highlights.
All user-facing text for the Practice feature is in English.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them only).
Do not edit any frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not add Firebase or Auth0 authentication (not supported on this platform).
Practice session persistence must be browser-only (no backend storage).
nonGoals: Storing practice sessions or user history in the canister.
Implementing WCA registration or pulling private user data from WCA.
